tool.name: applelink
tool.summary: Sets construction variables for the Apple linker (similar to the GNU linker).
tool.sets: FRAMEWORKPATHPREFIX _FRAMEWORKPATH _FRAMEWORKS LINKCOM SHLINKFLAGS SHLINKCOM LDMODULEPREFIX LDMODULESUFFIX LDMODULEFLAGS LDMODULECOM

cvar:
">
On Mac OS X with gcc, general user-supplied frameworks options to be added at the end of a command line building a loadable module. (This has been largely superceded by the &cv-link-FRAMEWORKPATH;, &cv-link-FRAMEWORKPATHPREFIX;, &cv-link-FRAMEWORKPREFIX; and &cv-link-FRAMEWORKS; variables described above.)

cvar.name: FRAMEWORKS
cvar.summary:
On Mac OS X with gcc, a list of the framework names to be linked into a program or shared library or bundle. The default value is the empty list. For example:
env.AppendUnique(FRAMEWORKS=Split('System Cocoa SystemConfiguration'))

cvar.name: FRAMEWORKPREFIX
cvar.summary: On Mac OS X with gcc, the prefix to be used for linking in frameworks (see &cv-link-FRAMEWORKS;). The default value is -framework.

cvar.name: _FRAMEWORKS
cvar.summary: On Mac OS X with gcc, an automatically-generated construction variable containing the linker command-line options for linking with FRAMEWORKS.

cvar.name: FRAMEWORKPATH
cvar.summary:
On Mac OS X with gcc, a list containing the paths to search for frameworks. Used by the compiler to find framework-style includes like #include <Fmwk/Header.h>. Used by the linker to find user-specified frameworks when linking (see &cv-link-FRAMEWORKS;). For example:
env.AppendUnique(FRAMEWORKPATH='#myframeworkdir')
will add
... -Fmyframeworkdir
to the compiler and linker command lines.

cvar.name: FRAMEWORKPATHPREFIX
cvar.summary: On Mac OS X with gcc, the prefix to be used for the FRAMEWORKPATH entries. (see &cv-link-FRAMEWORKPATH;). The default value is -F.

cvar.name: _FRAMEWORKPATH
cvar.summary: On Mac OS X with gcc, an automatically-generated construction variable containing the linker command-line options corresponding to &cv-link-FRAMEWORKPATH;.
